page.title: 10FOX HUNTING IN Melton Ross
page.content: This section of the county (a square 4 Kms to east and 3 Kms to north of 1104) is hunted by the Brocklesby Hunt Foxhounds.Due to the new roads the Hunt will now only hunt in this area once or twice during the season.The hunt meets every wednesday and saturday. There are 35 couples of hounds which are the property of the Earl of Yarborough. This hunt dates back to approx.1700. The 1st. Earl of Y. was master of the foxhounds in 1816 and currently since 1967 the present Earl is joint master, with Mr M F Strawson. At this time many people regard fox hunting as cruel and are campaigning to get it banned ,but most local residents are sympathetic to fox hunting because it is part of the heritage and way of life of the area.
